intro: Aster lipskii, commonly known as the Siberian aster, is a perennial herb native to the cold climates of Siberia and the Russian Far East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produces purple to blue flowers in the late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Aster lipskii is valued for its ornamental beauty and traditional use in herbal medicine.
